articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Current U.S. Domestic News: From Gun Trafficking to Presidential Debates
articles.description: This summary covers various major news events in the U.S., including an Arizona man's indictment for gun trafficking aimed at inciting a race war, Biden's endorsements from senior groups, Oklahoma court dismissing Tulsa race massacre reparations case, and updates on Biden-Trump presidential debates. Various legal and social issues, including immigration and gun possession, are discussed.
articles.content:
Following is a summary of current US domestic news briefs.
Arizona man charged with trafficking guns to kill Black people, start race war
An Arizona man has been indicted on four counts of gun-trafficking crimes after federal prosecutors said an unde... [5200 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Arizona's Seniors' Shifting Support: Trump Leads Over Biden in Key Poll
articles.description: A new poll reveals that voters over 50 in Arizona favor Donald Trump over Joe Biden in the upcoming election. The AARP poll indicates a significant lead for Trump among senior voters, exposing a potential vulnerability for Biden. Efforts to win back senior support include launching 'Seniors for Biden-Harris.'
articles.content: Voters over age 50 in the key battleground state of Arizona strongly favor Donald Trump in November's election rematch, a new poll from the U.S.'s largest organization for older Americans shows, highlighting a potential new weakness in Democrat Joe B... [1615 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: ACLU Sues Biden Administration Over Controversial Asylum Ban
articles.description: U.S. immigrant rights groups, led by the ACLU, have sued the Biden administration over a policy barring most migrants from seeking asylum if caught crossing the U.S.-Mexico border illegally. The lawsuit claims the policy violates U.S. asylum law and bypasses proper regulatory procedures. Biden's stance mirrors Trump-era policies.
articles.content: U.S. immigrant rights groups sued the Biden administration on Wednesday over a new policy that bars most migrants caught crossing the U.S.-Mexico border illegally from claiming asylum. The groups, led by the American Civil Liberties Union, argued res... [2602 chars]

articles.author: BreakingNews.ie
articles.title: Donald Trump returns to Capitol Hill and whips up Republican legislators
articles.description: The former US president was embraced by Republican legislators who find themselves newly energised by his bid to retake the White House.
articles.content:
Donald Trump made a return on Thursday to Capitol Hill, whipping up US House and Senate Republicans in his first meetings since the January 6 2021 attacks.
He was embraced by Republican legislators who find themselves newly energised by his bid to re... [4466 chars]

articles.author: BreakingNews.ie
articles.title: Trump arrives on Capitol Hill to meet with Republican lawmakers
articles.description: Trump arrives on Capitol Hill to meet with Republican lawmakers
articles.content:
Donald Trump arrived on Capitol Hill on Thursday to meet with Republican lawmakers to build unity ahead of the November 5th election, which could hand his party control of the White House and both chambers of Congress.
Mr Trump's motorcade pulled up ... [3640 chars]

articles.title: Former Atlanta prosecutor says he expects Trump will be tried in Georgia even if he wins the White House
articles.description: Former special prosecutor Nathan Wade says he believes Donald Trump will “absolutely” be put on trial in Georgia in the 2020 election subversion case – even if he wins a second term and he’s in the White House at the time.
articles.content:
CNN —
Former special prosecutor Nathan Wade says he believes Donald Trump will “absolutely” be put on trial in Georgia in the 2020 election subversion case – even if he wins a second term and he’s in the White House at the time.

articles.title: Immigration rights groups sue Biden administration over asylum directive
articles.description: Advocates say president’s directive restricting asylum claims differs little from Trump move blocked by courts
articles.content: A coalition of immigrant advocacy groups sued the Biden administration on Wednesday over President Joe Biden’s recent directive that in effect halts asylum claims at the southern border, saying it differs little from a similar move during the Trump a... [3120 chars]

articles.title: Hush money gag order stifles campaign speech: Donald Trump’s lawyers
articles.description: Before the trial began in April, Justice Juan Merchan issued the order after prosecutors argued Trump's history of making threatening statements showed he could derail proceedings.
articles.content:
Donald Trump's lawyers urged the judge who oversaw his hush money trial to lift a gag order now that he has been convicted, arguing his opponents were using the restrictions on the former U.S. president's speech as a "political sword."

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump's Legal Team Appeals to Lift Gag Order Post Conviction
articles.description: Donald Trump's lawyers have requested that the gag order imposed during his hush money trial be lifted after his conviction. They argue that the restrictions are being used politically by opponents. A Manhattan jury found Trump guilty of falsifying business records related to a payoff to Stormy Daniels before the 2016 election.
articles.content: Donald Trump's lawyers urged the judge who oversaw his hush money trial to lift a gag order now that he has been convicted, arguing his opponents were using the restrictions on the former U.S. president's speech as a "political sword." In a court fil... [2051 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Trump's Defense Fights Gag Order After Historic Conviction
articles.description: Donald Trump's lawyers have requested the removal of a gag order following his conviction, arguing it restricts his ability to respond to political attacks. The order was implemented to prevent Trump from influencing the trial. Despite being fined for violations, prosecutors advise keeping it until at least his sentencing.
articles.content:
By Luc Cohen NEW YORK, June 12 (Reuters) -
Donald Trump's lawyers urged the judge who oversaw his hush money trial to lift a gag order now that he has been convicted, arguing his opponents were using the restrictions on the former U.S. president's sp... [2122 chars]

articles.title: Here’s where top officials say Canada is vulnerable to Trump
articles.description: Canadians across all levels of government must engage in a co-ordinated approach to the very real prospect of a Trump win.

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Voter Sentiment Unchanged By Hunter Biden Trial Amid Presidential Election
articles.description: A Reuters/Ipsos poll reveals that 80% of U.S. voters say Hunter Biden's criminal conviction won't affect their vote in the upcoming presidential election. Contrastingly, 61% believe Donald Trump's conviction will have no impact. Independents mirror these sentiments closely, while both candidates fight for their support.
articles.content:
Most U.S. voters followed the criminal trial of President Joe Biden's son Hunter Biden and the vast majority say his conviction won't affect their vote in the Nov. 5 election, according to a Reuters/Ipsos poll that closed on Tuesday.
Some 67% of regi... [2340 chars]

articles.author: Livemint
articles.title: Trump Tells GOP He Plans to Entirely Reverse Biden’s EV Policy
articles.description: Donald Trump railed against President Joe Biden’s electric vehicle policies in a meeting with House Republicans Thursday and said he would undo them if he takes the White House in November, according to lawmakers who attended the private meeting.
articles.content: (Bloomberg) -- Donald Trump railed against President Joe Biden’s electric vehicle policies in a meeting with House Republicans Thursday and said he would undo them if he takes the White House in November, according to lawmakers who attended the priva... [1751 chars]

articles.title: Hunter Biden conviction could boost father against Trump, experts suggest
articles.description: Analysts say guilty verdict undermines Trump’s claim that a weaponised justice department is unfairly pursuing him

articles.title: Trump was hoping for a slam dunk. But Hunter Biden’s trial has only highlighted his father Joe’s dignity
articles.description: A lie is a lie, but the president’s support of his son - and of the legal system - has been moving to see, says Guardian columnist Emma Brockes
articles.content: If you didn’t know better, you might think the jury that found Hunter Biden guilty this week knew precisely what they were doing. The evidence against the president’s son – that he lied about his drug use on a firearms form six years ago – was overwh... [4367 chars]

articles.title: UAW members in Michigan don’t think the union’s endorsement of Biden will sway their pro-Trump peers
